OM_Jaheira_OOM.synopsis: Conversation with Jaheira's Daughter if your party has Jaheira in and your player is not nearby. Mainly backstory and context for Jaheira and her daughter. It would be great to touch on why Jaheira''s nervous to leave Baldur's Gate without her influence to help build into the Timeless Body scroll story.Currently is nearly identical to LOW_JaheiraAndDaughter01_OM_Jaheira_COM to try and capture the same beats, but absolutely can be different.
OM_Jaheira_OOM.how_to_trigger: - Go to Jaheira's House with Jaheira- Talk to Jaheira's Eldest Daughter inside the house, while staying in earshotBookmark: larian://bookmark?name=CTY_JaheirasHouse&mod=GustavDev&level=CTY_Main_A&camPos=-198.180267;36.128036;-47.551403&camTarget=-198.939575;35.720970;-47.043709

OM_Jaheira_COM.synopsis: Conversation with Jaheira's Daughter if your party has Jaheira in and your player is nearby. Mainly backstory and context for Jaheira and her daughter. It would be great to touch on why Jaheira''s nervous to leave Baldur's Gate without her influence to help build into the Timeless Body scroll story.
OM_Jaheira_COM.how_to_trigger: - Go to Jaheira's House with Jaheira- Talk to Jaheira's Eldest Daughter inside the house, while staying in earshotBookmark: larian://bookmark?name=CTY_JaheirasHouse&mod=GustavDev&level=CTY_Main_A&camPos=-198.180267;36.128036;-47.551403&camTarget=-198.939575;35.720970;-47.043709

OM_Jaheira_OOM_2.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_2.text: No arguing. Just tell me you're well.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_13.speaker: Minsc
OM_Jaheira_OOM_13.text: Boo is also very well. And happy to see you, Rion.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_8.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_8.text: And I him. Enough that I'll let him keep his lumbering, sweaty steed inside.
OM_Jaheira_OOM_8.context: NodeContext: Sniffing - referencing Boo's 'steed' Minsc, with whom she is unimpressed - then moving on.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_15.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_OOM_15.text: Back to himself, for better or worse.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_6.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_6.text: Good. I owe him a kicking for showing Fig how to throw hatchets.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_25.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_25.text: You'll get him back. I owe him a kicking for showing Fig how to throw hatchets.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_4.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_4.text: So. This cult - what's our plan?
OM_Jaheira_OOM_4.context: NodeContext: Straight to business - not even brooking the idea that she won't be involved with our efforts

OM_Jaheira_OOM_23.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_OOM_23.text: I'm not fool enough to think I can change your mind. But if you're staying, I don't want you taking up arms - there are other ways to fight.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_3.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_3.context: NodeContext: Flat, eyebrow cocked. Humouring what she thinks is a very dumb line of reasoning.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_5.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_OOM_5.text: We're well stocked with herbs. There's space below for beds - you might make this a healing house, should it come to fighting in the streets.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_16.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_16.text: A fair point, though I'll leave the herb-lore to Jord. I was always better at breaking bones than mending them.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_20.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_OOM_20.text: I remember. The very reason Jord had so many patients to hone his craft on.
OM_Jaheira_OOM_20.context: NodeContext: Wry. Her son only learned to heal by practising on the other children his daughter beat the shit out of

OM_Jaheira_OOM_22.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_22.text: If I have to stay home and babysit, then it's your job to make sure there's still a home to look after.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_1.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_1.text: Take what you need, and we'll do the grand reunion when you come back for good.
OM_Jaheira_OOM_1.context: NodeContext: Bulling through the sentimentality - she's releived to have her mother home, but doesn't want to actually relax until she's home for good.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_11.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_11.text: So, lovely as it is you to have you back, mother - go away. You have work to do.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_9.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_OOM_9.context: NodeContext: Smiling - knows her daughter is fobbing her off because she doesn't want to get sentimental. Understands and lets her off the hook.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_7.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_OOM_7.text: Wait. One more thing - there are doppelgangers on our trail. One even went so far as to steal my face.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_14.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_OOM_14.text: Hm. All right, then - if you turn up looking for hugs and kisses, I'll make sure to shoot first.
OM_Jaheira_OOM_14.context: NodeContext: Been told about dangerous shapechangers who might imitate Jaheira. Taking it in her stride.

OM_Jaheira_OOM_19.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_OOM_19.text: Wait. One more thing. There are doppelgangers among the cult - be on your guard.

OM_Jaheira_COM_6.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_6.text: No arguing. Just tell me you're well.

OM_Jaheira_COM_26.speaker: Minsc
OM_Jaheira_COM_26.text: Boo is also very well. And happy to see you, Rion.

OM_Jaheira_COM_9.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_9.text: And I him. Enough that I'll let him keep his lumbering, sweaty steed inside.
OM_Jaheira_COM_9.context: NodeContext: Sniffing - referencing Boo's 'steed' Minsc, with whom she is unimpressed - then moving on.

OM_Jaheira_COM_1.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_1.text: So. This cult - what's our plan?
OM_Jaheira_COM_1.context: NodeContext: Straight to business - not even brooking the idea that she won't be involved with our efforts

OM_Jaheira_COM_14.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_COM_14.text: I'm not fool enough to think I can change your mind. But if you're staying, I don't want you taking up arms - there are other ways to fight.

OM_Jaheira_COM_32.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_32.context: NodeContext: Flat, eyebrow cocked. Humouring what she thinks is a very dumb line of reasoning.

OM_Jaheira_COM_4.speaker: Player
OM_Jaheira_COM_4.text: There are refugees outside the walls. They'll need protection.

OM_Jaheira_COM_23.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_COM_23.text: ...You shame me. In all our hunting, I had put them from my mind.

OM_Jaheira_COM_3.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_3.text: Right. Leave them to us, then. If we can't get them past the checkpoints, we'll at least make sure they're watched over if it comes to fighting in the streets.
OM_Jaheira_COM_3.context: NodeContext: Working it through a moment, then matter of factly taking on the job we've given her.

OM_Jaheira_COM_17.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_17.text: If I have to stay home and babysit, then it's your job to make sure there's still a home to look after.

OM_Jaheira_COM_2.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_2.text: Take what you need, and we'll do the grand reunion when you come back for good.
OM_Jaheira_COM_2.context: NodeContext: Bulling through the sentimentality - she's releived to have her mother home, but doesn't want to actually relax until she's home for good.

OM_Jaheira_COM_0.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_0.text: So, lovely as it is you to have you back, mother - go away. You have work to do.

OM_Jaheira_COM_25.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_COM_25.context: NodeContext: Smiling - knows her daughter is fobbing her off because she doesn't want to get sentimental. Understands and lets her off the hook.

OM_Jaheira_COM_7.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_COM_7.text: Wait. One more thing - there are doppelgangers on our trail. One even went so far as to steal my face.

OM_Jaheira_COM_19.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_19.text: Hm. All right, then - if you turn up looking for hugs and kisses, I'll make sure to shoot first.
OM_Jaheira_COM_19.context: NodeContext: Been told about dangerous shapechangers who might imitate Jaheira. Taking it in her stride.

OM_Jaheira_COM_16.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_COM_16.text: Wait. One more thing. There are doppelgangers among the cult - be on your guard.

OM_Jaheira_COM_13.speaker: Player
OM_Jaheira_COM_13.text: Healers. This place could serve as a hospital.

OM_Jaheira_COM_30.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_30.text: A fair point, though I'll leave the herb-lore to Jord. I was always better at breaking bones than mending them.

OM_Jaheira_COM_24.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_COM_24.text: I remember. The very reason Jord had so many patients to hone his craft on.
OM_Jaheira_COM_24.context: NodeContext: Wry. Her son only learned to heal by practising on the other children his daughter beat the shit out of

OM_Jaheira_COM_20.speaker: Player
OM_Jaheira_COM_20.text: Ignore Jaheira - if it comes to it, pick up a sword.

OM_Jaheira_COM_15.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_15.text: I favour the hammer. But ignoring her, I mastered at a very young age.
OM_Jaheira_COM_15.context: NodeContext: Smiling, sharing a joke with us

OM_Jaheira_COM_8.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_8.text: Jaheira's never had much trust in the gods. Wonder why.
OM_Jaheira_COM_8.context: NodeContext: Smiling, sharing a joke with us. (Jaheira has spent her life fighting gods / children of gods)

OM_Jaheira_COM_12.speaker: Jaheira
OM_Jaheira_COM_12.text: Back to himself, for better or worse.

OM_Jaheira_COM_18.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_18.text: Good. I owe him a kicking for showing Fig how to throw hatchets.

OM_Jaheira_COM_29.speaker: Rion
OM_Jaheira_COM_29.text: You'll get him back. I owe him a kicking for showing Fig how to throw hatchets.
